channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The path to Gotherington is covered in pig manure., 18th May
item.description:
The right of way footpath through the field to Gotherington is covered in pig manure put there by the farmer. It is in the field with the pylons. It is a tripping hazard and one is unable to walk on it because of the large lumps. The manure has not been spread over the rest of the field. Every year the farmer ploughs through the right of way patch, this year it is worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coffin Path, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very uneven pavement making it difficult for wheelchair user to navigate the pavement safely and in comfort, 18th May
item.description:
The footpath infront of Cheltenham ladies college and health and fitness centre leading to the entrance to the Honeybourne line on Malvern Road is so damaged that my mother nearly fell out of her wheelchair while I tried to wheel her safely for a walk on the Honeybourne line. It is getting worse every time we go.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malvern Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Parking in a Turning Area, 18th May
item.description:
Having had the turning circle outside our house drastically altered to become a wider pavement, a cycle lane and a new turning area, we have been told that double yellow lines should have been painted all along the far side of the road including the turning area. This hasn't been done and this is what is happening. It makes it almost impossible for visitors to our houses to park unless they use the pavement and completely impossible for larger delivery vehicles to turn safely without risking hitting pedestrians and cyclists. How much longer do we need to wait until the yellow lines are added and people's safety taken seriously.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dancey Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large item has been fly tipped, 18th May
item.description:
There is a large Coca Cola sign in the grass verge. It maybe a drinks fridge but you can only see the side of it. It’s been there for about a week.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury

item.title: Very large long extended pot hole. Turning from the by pass into towards Ermin Street is very dangerous as you have to swerve to avoid the two or three large long potholes. Need to be done ASAP as will damage cars wheels., 17th May
item.description:
At the traffic lights where you can go straight over towards the business park or turn left onto Ermin Street. Potholes are directly on the right turn into Ermin Street. Very dangerous every morning I have to slow right down and swerve to avoid. Will damage wheels as very long two or three in same area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The grass is too long to see on coming traffic, 17th May
item.description:
There are several ‘pull ins’ for the residents along Gloucester Road. The grass is too long and is now obscuring the view of on coming traffic. This has become problematic over the last couple of week. This road is a 50 so it’s quite dangerous. I am heavily pregnant so I am concerned for my safety when trying to see. It stretches from the hoo nursery to just after the glevum car sales garage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
